content.description: Cycloheximide <math alttext="or C H X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>CHX</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a eukaryote protein synthesis inhibitor. It is used in biomedical research to inhibit protein synthesis in eukaryotic cells studied in vitro. Its effects are rapidly reversed by simply removing it from the culture medium.
content.question: In a translation experiment using a fungus culture, radiolabeled amino acids were added to the culture, allowing the researchers to measure the growth of a single polypeptide chain by measuring counts per minute <math alttext="or C P M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>CPM</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. As the chain grew, the <math alttext="C P M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CPM</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increased. After a certain amount of time, <math alttext="C H X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CHX</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was added to the mixture, and the experiment continued. After an additional amount of time, the <math alttext="C H X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CHX</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was removed from the culture medium. Which of the following graphs best predicts the data collected during the experiment?

choices.label: The figure presents a line graph in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, the vertical axis is labeled C P M and the origin is labeled 0. Arrowheads are present at the end of each axis. The line begins at the origin and moves up and to the right at a constant rate. About one third of the way along the horizontal axis, an inhibitor is added, and the line continues to move up and to the right at the same rate. At about two thirds of the way along the horizontal axis, the inhibitor is removed, and the line moves horizontally to the right.
